meanings.sent1: Some ancient cultures practiced ditheisms, worshipping two separate deities.
meanings.sent2: In ditheisms, followers acknowledge the existence of two distinct divine beings.
meanings.sent3: The ditheisms of old legends often led to tales of rivalry between the two gods.
meanings.sent4: The concept of ditheisms can be compared to having two kings ruling different realms.
meanings.sent5: The idea of ditheisms can be confusing for those accustomed to monotheistic beliefs.

meanings.sent1: Legends speak of ancient civilizations engaging in ditheisms, honoring two gods equally.
meanings.sent2: In ditheisms, devotees offer prayers and sacrifices to two separate deities.
meanings.sent3: Some stories depict humorous situations arising from the rituals of ditheisms.
meanings.sent4: The practice of ditheisms can be seen as balancing two divine forces in harmony.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of ditheisms lies in the duality of reverence towards two distinct gods.

meanings.sent1: Scholars study ancient texts to understand the origins of ditheisms, the belief in two gods.
meanings.sent2: The doctrine of ditheisms emphasizes the coexistence of two powerful divine entities.
meanings.sent3: In fictional stories, characters sometimes struggle with the complexities of ditheisms.
meanings.sent4: The doctrine of ditheisms can be seen as a philosophical exploration of dualism.
meanings.sent5: The doctrine of ditheisms challenges traditional monotheistic views with its dual divine nature.
